item.title: Full dog poo bags dumped x 6, 23rd November
item.description:
Someone is continually dropping full dog poo bags both on pavement and in parking bay outside No.69. At least 6 there again. Have cleared them all previously but not doing so again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 23rd November
item.description:
Potholes for 6 months + gradually getting worse and more dangerous. Outside numbers 43 & 47 and further potholes going up the road. These are never attended to it seems like those at the bottom of the road. The speed humps are crumbling also and need repainting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 23rd November
item.description:
Blocking the pavement and at head hight

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitmore Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The BT manhole cover is very slippery when wet., 23rd November
item.description:
Somehow this rectangular manhole cover is very slippery when wet. I just managed to catch my wife as she was falling to the floor. I then tried and my shoes were also failing to grip. Everywhere else in Bromley was fine. On our return, I tried again carefully and this manhole cover is definitely too slippery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wendover Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped bench-table, 23rd November
item.description:
This bench table was stolen from the Pyrotechnist Arms while it was out of business and dumped in this location. It is unsightly, unsafe, unstable, a fire risk and detracts from the park furniture in the vicinity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Kirkwood Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working., 23rd November
item.description:
The street light on the corner of Dulwich Wood Avenue and Rusholme Grove SE19 1 HF is not working. A new light has been installed but not working. Old light still there but not working and needs to be removed. This situation has been ongoing for several months. Now that it gets dark early it is dangerous as one cannot see where one is going. Please sort it out as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Wood Avenue, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Items left, 23rd November
item.description:
There has been a mattress left on my drive way for two weeks and I have reported it but it’s not been collected. Now I’ve gone outside tonight and there is a white shelving unit and a few recycle bags also dumped outside my house by my bin.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southgate Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Flytipping in alley next to Sternhall Lane, 23rd November
item.description:
Rubbish is always dumped in this alley next to Sternhall Lane. Recently someone put a couple of bins there but they are always overflowing and other rubbish is dumped there. We don’t report it all the time but it is particularly bad now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sternhall Lane, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 218, Eversholt Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London

item.title: Large pothole at the end of the junction entering the roundabout, 23rd November
item.description:
This pothole has been here for at least a month and it seems to be getting wider. I keep hitting it each week since it's very difficult to avoid.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big cracks from one side to the other, 23rd November
item.description:
Every time a heavy vehicle or a buses goes over the crack it vibrates through the house and makes the radiators vibrate the road looks like its sinking and big cracks are appearing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Mickleham Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime blocking pavement, 23rd November
item.description:
Lime hire bike(s) blocking pavement or dropped kerb. Hazard for pedestrians, wheelchair users and prams. Please remove and monitor area for repeat dumping.
